queries.description: Privileged containers lack essential security restrictions and should be avoided by removing the 'privileged' flag or by changing its value to false
Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=spark-role.rules.verbs should not contain a wildcard value when metadata.name=spark-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=spark-role.rules.verbs contains a wildcard value and metadata.name=spark-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=hub.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=hub.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=hub.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=hub.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-olap.rules.verbs should not contain a wildcard value when metadata.name=release-name-olap.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-olap.rules.verbs contains a wildcard value and metadata.name=release-name-olap.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=splicedb-operator.rules.verbs should not contain a wildcard value when metadata.name=splicedb-operator.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=splicedb-operator.rules.verbs contains a wildcard value and metadata.name=splicedb-operator.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions 'bind' or 'escalate' allow subjects to create new bindings with other roles. This is dangerous, as users with these privileges can bind to roles that may exceed their own privileges

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{splicedb-operator}}.rules[7].verbs should not include the 'bind' and/or 'escalate' permission

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-haproxy-controller-default}}.rules[2] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-haproxy-controller-default}}.rules[2] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, patch, update) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-nginx-ingress}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-nginx-ingress}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-nginx-ingress}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-nginx-ingress}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

queries.query_name: Role Binding To Default Service Account
queries.description: No role nor cluster role should bind to a default service account
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Cronjobs must have a configured deadline, which means the attribute 'startingDeadlineSeconds' must be defined

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.
